Reviews.Title: “Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Ingersoll
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very modern and clean, the staff was amazing ! Pierro was helpful and kind ! The location was perfect for tourists. You are walking distance from many places including lots of shops. The restaurant Grill & Wine next to the hotel is excellent for a quick meal and a nice wine list. Make sure to get your coupon from the front desk ! Be careful when ordering fish anywhere as they price it by the gram and sometimes don't tell you. Make sure to confirm your price before your done placing your order. The breakfast was perfect. The rooms were cleaned and ready before check in time, which was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller1983
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 night trip to Rome staying at the White Hotel. The hotel is in a great location - we were able to walk to all points of interest within Rome easily. We stayed in one of the newly refurbished executive rooms - the room was modern and clean - albeit a little small, however was not a problem as we did not spend much time in our room. The breakfast buffet had a good selection. The staff at reception were very friendly. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Richard I
Reviews.Content: Whites is situated about a 3 minute walk from the Trevi Fountain, 10 minutes from Spanish Steps and 20-25 minutes from the Colesseum. The room was compact, but had plenty of storage space, was clean, with modern decor and well lit. The bathroom was on the mezzanine level, with an additional toilet downstairs off the bedroom. Staff were friendly and helpful. We only ate breakfast at the hotel, which was perfectly adequate, cold meats, scrambled eggs, choice of 3 cereals, yogurt, fruit, croissants and bread. Seating in the restaurant was tight. There are plenty of places to eat in the surrounding area, with prices to suit all pockets. A really great place to base oneself.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Value and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Arriving first thing in the morning, they bent over backwards to get us into a room immediately and were very helpful with our jet lagged confusion. The day and night concierge Paolo and Alex were both friendly, well-informed and spoke excellent english. Te breakfast was great with very friendly service as well. This will become our second home in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sharon S
Reviews.Content: First time in Rome. Hotel ideally located. Easy to reach using train from airport to Termini and then catching metro Line A. All major attractions within walking distance. Trevi Fountain nearby. Hotel very clean. Breakfast buffet gave you a good choice of food . Room small but well designed. Staff very friendly and helpful. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Stefan K
Reviews.Content: We've just spent four days in Rome – room was very modern and clean. Staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast was buffet – very good. Great location – just minutes from the Trevi fountain. Street a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: JmtjHATTON
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful trip to Rome. We stayed at the Hotel White in Rome which is part of the Travelroma group. From our original booking in December 2011 with initital enquiries by telephone and confirmation by email the Hotel is faultless. All the staff, chambermaid and the staff who looked after us at breakfast were kind, attentive and always very polite. Paolo greets you on arrival and looks after your every need. What ever you ask he is able to help you and does so in a very professional and kind manner. The hotel is exceptionally clean, exceptionally quiet for being so central. You are minutes from the Trevi Fountain and within the historical centre of the City. If you are thinking of visiting Rome we recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: ampatrick
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at the Hotel White in Rome. The hotel is located on a small street leading to the Tivoli Fountain a short distance away. Lots of shops (tourist, handbags, shoes, etc) and restaurants mean there's lots to do locally. The hotel is also only a few blocks away from the Metro line. We walked to most locations, but caught the train over to the Vatican City to save our legs. THe hotel itself is very clean. We had a corner room on the top floor - spacious for two people, but a bit crowded for three. The bathroom was a little tired but the shower was fabulous. I think the lower floors had been renovated. The beds were very comfortable. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. The breakfast room is however tiny but the food was good. We'd happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Superb location”
Reviews.Author: oferorna
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days at the "White Hotel" last week. The rooms are small yet comfortable, cozy and clean. The hotel staff - very friendly and helpful and the location......Superb !!! All the major attractions within a walking distance. The only downside is the small dining room, but the good breakfast covered up for that !! Rome is magnificent and we'll definitely come back to the "White". The Schneids

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: Nickybitty
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights a couple of weeks ago.. The hotel is very clean and the staff friendly and very helpful. The restaurants booked by the front desk were spot on and overall a good place to stay. Yes the rooms were small but all you needed was provided however the location made up for that. We want to go back to Rome and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very central-”
Reviews.Author: indefatigable
Reviews.Content: Hotel White as the taxi drivers will call it is very central and very convenient. The penalty is that you will need to book well ahead, it's not cheap ( is anything in Rome?), and the rooms are very small. The breakfast service can be chaotic although you will always get enough to eat. Visiting repeatedly over the years our rooms have always been clean and the bathrooms adequate. The basics are good, decent shower pressure and always hot water. During the coldest snap for 27 years the hotel was warm. I suspect you would have to go very upmarket to get a better choice in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NickAAAA
Reviews.Content: Great spot with everything in walking distance. Standard rooms small but well fitted. Breakfast area too small and quite a challenge in the mornings. Watch out if you book through BA as they offer superior room but they only have standard or exec . Down side is wifi costs but that's it. Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room we've ever stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: PoshBirdWinchester
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a package with BA & can only assume we were given the smallest room in the hotel because of this! It was big enough for a double bed & a small wardrobe.....and that was it! The 2 of us could not move around together - if I wanted to walk round the bed my husband had to sit on it so I had room. It was also very noisey with little soundproofing so every footstep along the hall could be heard, together with every conversation that was going on. The staff were also very noisey in the corridor from 7am onwards & on Valentine's Day we were woken at 7:30am to the sound of drilling! Having said that the room and bathroom were very clean & the bed was very comfortable. Friends we went with were upgraded to a suite due to previous problems and this was very spacious with a lounge area, bedroom & separate bathroom. Location of the hotel is excellent with all major sights within walking distance with the exception of the Vatican City but this was only a 10Euro taxi ride away for the 4 of us. The restaurant attached to the hotel is very good and you're given a 10% discount card on checking in which is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION- very nice stuff”
Reviews.Author: Sem79
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful, very central, close to all major attractions by walk. Excellent breakfast, the room very clean , but very small Nice and helpful staff, Highly recommended , for sure, we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Sue C
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a weekend break in Rome and stayed at the White Hotel. The hotel was brilliant, excellent value for money. The staff were incredibly welcoming and helpful. The rooms, while not large, were very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was good, with a wide range of different options, lovely rolls! The location was great, the Trevi fountain was literally a stone's throw away and we walked everywhere. I would recommend the hotel as an excellent place to stay if you are sightseeing in Rome. As another reviewer said " A real little gem!"

Reviews.Title: “Great location and experience”
Reviews.Author: Stephenfamilyofsix
Reviews.Content: We stayed in White Hotel for two nights in two apartments as we are a family of six. The accommodation was in an excellent location. The rooms were relatively spacious and had plenty of storage areas. Also very modern and clean. The breakfast buffet had a reasonable selection and the quality was very good. The only challenge being the breakfast room was quite small. This made it difficult to get seated and get food from the buffet. The staff were friendly. Check in and Checkout were hassle free. I have no hesitation in recommending Hotel White for families.

Reviews.Title: “City break”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this well located hotel in Rome for three days in July 2011. Room was a good size with two large beds - one on a mezzanine floor. Bathroom well equipped and of adequate size. Breakfast is taken in a pleasant dining room wit a good selection of the usual things one finds in european hotels. Very good choice of restaurants nearby for lunch and dinner. Particularly liked ease to get to all the tourist spots as all easily accessibke on foot - Trevi, Spanish Steps, Vatican etc

Reviews.Title: “the best location”
Reviews.Author: IB10
Reviews.Content: good location , small lobey , good breackfest staff very nice and helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: TanjaF
Reviews.Content: I found this little gem of a hotel and I would love to stay again. The room was clean and bright. The breakfast was great and the location was more than perfect. I had no idea how close to the Trevi Fountain we were until the next morning after our arrival. Located on a pedestrian street lined with shops, cafes, restaurants and gelato shops.

Reviews.Title: “Finally.. the hotel I've been looking for!”
Reviews.Author: danshim s
Reviews.Content: White Hotel really made me so happy by the time I stayed there. I've never been to a similar hotel like White Hotel. I am giving them a perfect score for great service and relaxing ambiance. I really loved my experience there! A+++++

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay at White Hotel”
Reviews.Author: helder k
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with the services of the hotel staff. The hotel is very clean and it is indeed perfect for relaxation. I recommend White Hotel to other tourists who wish to visit Italy.

Reviews.Title: “In terms of Rome it's a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shani_Navit
Reviews.Content: Location is great. Rooms were very clean. Staff at the front desk was kind and helpful. Breakfast was all right and included vegetables. The adjustable bed was nice. The surround system in the room was nice. Shower and facilities were ok. We were given a room on the first floor but it was noisy so we immediately changed it to a ground floor room which had no view and was darker and smaller but quiet. Our mattress was smaller than the bed. We could still hear the guests from the next room and smell their smoking. Breakfast was nicer than usual in hotels in Italy but the bread was stale and the eggs were not hot. The staff at the breakfast room were effective but noisy. We would expect much more from a hotel at this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: msuzdak
Reviews.Content: Down the block from the Trevi, central to most of the tourist spots in Rome. We had a great time - the rooms were very nicely laid out and furnished. Service was very good but do not try to get breakfast at 9AM as you will wait on line to eat. We found that before 8:30 there is no problem. We had one problem with the electric but it was fixed ASAP. Very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “White Hotel - Roma”
Reviews.Author: Stuart C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights at the end of September 2011. Firstly, the staff in the hotel are excellent. Always helpful and polite, especially the front desk. The location of the hotel is the main selling point. A few minutes from Trevi fountain, then further to Pantheon and Spanish Steps. Then the other other tourist sites are a short taxi or bus ride away. The rooms we had were on the third floor and were of good standard, if a little wear and tear showing. However, they were clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a tad small and the shower difficult to move in. Be careful with the safe, no instructions on how to use it so we had to ask. The doorman came to the room and went through it with us clearly. A good example that the hotel staff are the main asset of the hotel. Being near a busy street we were worried about the noise, but at no time was our sleep disturbed by the street outside. Breakfast was good, though the room was in the basement and a bit boring to be in. The bar was shut each night, mainly because most people were outside in the lovely weather at local bars and restaurant. I would recommend the bar and grill restaurant next door and associated with the hotel. Good value for money and choice of food to keep all happy. As previously mentioned, wifi is an additional cost. I used it in the lobby to get boarding passes at Eur3 for the hour. No printer, but staff said email the boarding passes to their email and then they printed for us. Yet again I have stayed at bigger, more expensive hotels and never received this level of service. The hotel organised a car to return to the airport in. At Eur45 (3 people), good value for money compared to the Leonardo Express. Would highly recommend this hotel for any stay in Roma and I will definately use it when returning to see those other Roman sites were run out of time to see.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Zietta04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at White hotel twice this year and both times the rooms and staff were fantastic.They even rememberd our names.Our room was two story.Toliet on both levels and bathroom upstairs.Clean and spotless in a central location to trevi fountain.Breakfast was nice.Staff were always helpful when requesting information or help. We never had dinner at the hotel however outside to the right was a great place called thats amore was of good value for money and great tasting food.Would stay here again if back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a very center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: MoscowPavel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights during our trip to Italy in August 2010. We where 3 adults and 2 kids 4&7. The location is perfect. All main attractions were in a short walk. Trevi fontain is 2 min walk. Highly recomend to go there in the evening - amaizing! Actually we got what we expected - the good level hol with great location. 2 nights we stayed in a rooms on a 3st floor - not so spacy but cosy. Other 3 night we've been in a rooms on a 2d floor - cosy and sylish "white" rooms. Each room on 1st 2 floors had 2 level. On a low level was a bedroom&toilet and on the high level was a bedroom&bathroom. It's really convinient if you travelling with 1 or 2 kids, so you can fit in 1 room. Although those rooms needs some renovation. The breakfast was good and tasty. We also had a good lunch&dinner in a hotel's restaurant. We really enjoyed the dinner with a good beef and wide selection of wines. The staff was very welcome. We had a easy transportation to the airport. Recomended to all travellers with kids as a good hotel in a very center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel White!!”
Reviews.Author: Rish22
Reviews.Content: We originally booked the Hotel White Apartment for five nights and did not like it at all. It was 100 metres or so from the main hotel, through a large courtyard. It was split level and we did not feel it was suitable to leave our young children alone downstairs while we slept upstairs. Also, the airconditioning was terrible and the furniture was quite dirty. After one night, I requested to move in to a suite in the main hotel. Thankfully, there was a family suite available and our remaining four nights in Rome were superb! We loved the lovely clean, white rooms and particularly the ipod dock! The breakfasts were delicious and the staff very friendly and spoke excellent English. I would definitely stay at Hotel White again if I am fortunate enough to return to Rome! It was so nice to return to a lovely room after hours spent walking in the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: EDC77
Reviews.Content: Great location. Right in middle of main attractions. Easy to get back to the hotel to rest, drop off shopping, ect. Clean and nice. Service was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Tewfiks4
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very friendly staff, EXCELLENT Location (SUPER SUPER)

Reviews.Title: “Very Central Location”
Reviews.Author: jforjohn
Reviews.Content: We have visited Rome a few times, and I must say that the location of the hotel is excellent being central within the historic centre of Rome and very close to the Trevi Fountain. The rooms were very clean, though somewhat small for a family of 4; with bathroom/shower facilities being "tight" in terms of space. Staff were courteous, friendly and helpful. During our stay, the lift was temperamental so we often had to walk up a no. of flights of stairs to get to our room. Also given its rating, we would have expected Wifi / computer access to be incorporated into the room rate. Despite the above, we would stay again as its location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you have cash when their terminal doesnt work”
Reviews.Author: Curtp23
Reviews.Content: We stayed their twice last month and found the hotel excellent in a great location. The only drawback they have a primitive transaction terminal that is unreliable. The result is when you try to use your cards and they dont work you have to scramle for cash. Not easy to find at the end of a long trip, but as a staff member commented to me very common. My tip, pay upfront or at least contact your bank or Amex to sort out the communication issues before you are rushing back to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rome”
Reviews.Author: Buddhasue
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself were lucky enough to visit Rome in June for our 30th Wedding Anniversary. We stayed for 4 nights with 5 whole days sightseeing. Rome is a beautiful City with so much to see, the White Hotel is a few hundred yards from the Trevie Fountain, which is beautiful. The White Hotel is a really lovely city hotel, we were lucky to be upgraded, which is the first time in all our travels. The room was not huge but big enough as you are out all day sightseeing. It was cleaned every day with clean towels, the reception staff were really helpful. We had a ticket for the open top bus which was a good idea as you can hop and off so can get your bearings to where all the sights are located. The weather was hot and Rome is really expensive, a small cup of coffe was 5 euros, the food is expensive too beween 60 - 70 euros for a 2 course meal which was not exceptional and the service was not that good either. The best meal we had and the best value for money was the Hard Rock Cafe, the food was exceptional and the staff were friendly. The worst restaurant we ate in was the El Presidente just down from the hotel, the food was really expensive, the waiter was rude and the food was not good, they charged 10 euros for a small plate of vegetables, the service was so quick we had a 2 course meal in 30 minutes, not the leisurely eating experience we had expected. If you get a change to visit Rome and would like a city hotel within walking distance of all the sights I would recommend the White Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: geminitraveller
Reviews.Content: White Hotel is located about 5 minutes from the Spanish Steps and about 3 minutes to the Trevi Fountain. It's actually between those 2 locations. The area where the hotel is located has lots of souvenir shops and dining places. It's a street always teeming with tourists but it is quite tight and sometimes vehicles have a hard time passing through. Our airport shuttle service had to leave us at the beginning of the street about 20 meters from the hotel door because it could not go through and we had to walk with all our luggages. But it's a short walk so we didn't mind. The reception staff was nice and helpful. We even requested for some extra time before check out and they agreed without much fuss. The room is just the right size for a comfortable stay. Our room had a shower but no bath tub. It's clean and that's what's important. Free buffet breakfast served at the basement is good enough to start our day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Niki045
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying in this hotel and will go back. The reception staff were friendly, helpful and approachable. We were spending 4 nights with friends of ours but our room was very small. However, the next night we were upgraded to a mini suite and the room was perfect. The rooms were well decorated and clean. The buffet breakfast had good choice but the breakfast room is under ground level with no windows, which is a shame. The coffee was good thoough. The real benefit of this hotel is its location. It is close to all of the major attractions you would want to visit in Rome. Most are in comfortable walking distance. We certainly intend going back as we really enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Good surprise at a side street”
Reviews.Author: TuristfromBrazil
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 30 year old year son stayed for 3 nights at thishotel, the reception area will be renovated, our room was already renovated a 2 story room, ours was downstairs with a bath without shower and my sons´s was upstairs with a complete and modern bathroom. Breakfast was good, the staff was very friendly they help us printing our boarding passes. The location is only 2 blocks from Fontana di Trevvi, no need to say A MUST SEE SITE. Lots of nice stores for small gifts very near and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great room.”
Reviews.Author: dearaujoa355
Reviews.Content: We arrived without a reservation and spoke to one of the hotel managers. He let us preview the room, which we found absolutely perfect, and provided us with an excellent rate. The hotel is very clean, very modern, and yet is still very obviously Italian, the charm is in every detail. The cleaning service did a fabulous job, every day. And breakfast is in the basement floor, and was delicious. There is beverage service and an all-you-want-to-eat breakfast buffet. There is an elevator. The a/c in the hotel room, as well as the common spaces of the hotel was very comfortable. Everyone was extremely courteous. There was always someone to great you, no matter what time of day or night. The hotel has a very nice mac computer to use for internet access. It is 3Euros for 1 hour, which is a very fair price. No hidden fees with hotel charge, breakfast was included. The bathroom was lovely, and there was always restocked towels and amenities. There was a full-size bed on the bottom floor of the hotel room which doubled as a couch. This extra sleeping space made it very comfortable if my husband or myself wanted to take a nap, the other person was free to recline as well without being a disturbance. I was very glad we walked up to this hotel, it made our trip very enjoyable. It is just steps from the Trevi Fountain and the Metro is about 5 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: MandyHarpaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by family and it really was excellent. The staff were charming, helpful and friendly and arranged everything we needed. The location couldn't be better (we walked to most places). We received an upgrade to a mini-suite and the room was well-appointed and well thought out. We slept very well in the crisp white freshly laundered sheets! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location - value for money - not that good”
Reviews.Author: peretzb
Reviews.Content: I have been there on May 2011. the location is very good, the service is very good but value for money I believe there are more hotel near by that we can pay less for the same type/class of room

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL IN EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: dan2308
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location Trevi fountain minute walk Five minutes from the Spanish Steps You can reach all the famous sites of Rome on foot Great breakfast The hotel staff gives good service Attention Small rooms on the third floor Old Design You should book rooms on the second floor or first floor Larger rooms and very modern Rooms have Climate Control Speakers to ipod You can make coffee in the room Adjustable electric beds Parquet floor

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION,location,location”
Reviews.Author: mottib
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. The rooms are very small & the beds are not good enough

Reviews.Title: “Rome was fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: gelati2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean.The rooms are smaller than some hotels, but you only sleep in them as there is so much to see and do in Rome.The beds were very comfortable Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. There was plenty of choice for breakfast. We really enjoyed our stay and would happily re-book this hotel when we return to Rome. The situation was perfect for walking to see most of the major attractions Rome has to offer, the Metro was just over 5mins walk from the hotel. Eating out wasn't a problem with lots of reasonably priced restaurants, better than other areas with less choice. The hotel faces one of the streets leading to the Trevis fountain and can be noisy but the double glazing is effective (or take ear plugs)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - But Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JTonto013
Reviews.Content: Hotel White is a perfect location, a beautiful street with pleanty of shops and trattoria's or resturants, and steps away from the beautiful "Trevi Fountain" . The rooms are accomodating however the beds are not so comfortable, we felt as though we were in a hospital room because the beds were adjustable and a bit low to the floor . A bit different . Hotel staff was courteous but we felt as though we were bothersome to them and they weren't as helpful as we were hoping for. Breakfast was provided and it was okay nothing great to brag about.

Reviews.Title: “A great and intimate hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: ogerson22
Reviews.Content: A great and intimate hotel Great location A short walking distance from major attractions and shopping Good restaurant – great breakfast and dinner Clean rooms with nice supplies Excellent service – very professional and helpful On our next visit to Rome we will certainly stay here again Osnat & Oded Gerson

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff with a hotel in an ideal location for visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: swan73
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel White are very welcoming and helpful, and they enjoy talking with guests in an open and friendly way. The hotel is in central Rome near the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and only 15 minutes walk from the Spanish Steps i.e. in a really good location for a visitor. You walk out straight into a great neighborhood. The staff were helpful telling us where things were on the Rome map and they recommended a good Italian restaurant with Italian cooking (as opposed to tourist coking.) The hotel must have been renovated in the last year or so. The bedrooms in the hotel follow its name in that the rooms and upstairs corridors are very white, all of which suited our taste! The rooms are very comfortable and modern in their decor. It would have been nice if the WiFi had been free but it seems fairly normal to have to pay extra for this in most hotels. If I go to Rome again I would certainly book to go to the Hotel White again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel saved our Roman holiday”
Reviews.Author: gatormom79
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure who would not recommend this hotel. It's fabulous. The people, like Piero, were WONDERFUL! He went above and beyond his job description many times to help us and our family. The breakfast was wonderful and whoever says otherwise, needs to remember it's hotel food. The servers were so nice and welcoming. We moved from a Bed and Breakfast down the street because our room had many problems, one of which was mold, and our vacation was becoming a disaster. I stopped by the Hotel White to see if they could help us and give us a room for the rest of our vacation without breaking the bank. They were so accommodating! They saved our holiday vacation. We also have a 15 month old and getting warm milk for him was NEVER an issue. I recommend this hotel to everyone. It's clean, friendly, and right down the street from the Trevi fountain. It's also very quiet at night. The windows keep the noise of the city out. There is a fridge in the rooms and a door that separates the bedroom from the mini family room. It's fantastic. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and will recommend it to our family who are planning to come in Rome in May. Thank you to the staff at the Hotel White. You made our Christmas vacation a wonderful one!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and perfect service”
Reviews.Author: uuu100
Reviews.Content: We were at white hotel for 4 night on the hollidays.We upgraded the rooms to superiour room and it was worth' the room was very clean with al we need, the concierge was very nice and the location of the hotel was perfect, evry thing is close and can be walked on feet; We recommend this hotel for evry one whoe want to travel in Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “White Hotel was perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: DenverDebby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White Hotel from Nov.16-21. It was part of a British Airway package and fit our needs very well. Yes the room was small but the price was right and it was very clean, updated, quiet and the beds were very comfortable, an important quality for many middle-aged women like me. They were actually adjustable so even though the room was too small for a chair or two, we would come back to our room in the late afternoon after a day of sightseeing on foot, for a little "siesta" and enjoyed being able to snooze with our feet up or catch a little CNN on the hd tv, before heading out for the evening. The bathroom was roomy with a shower and we found that the footstool intended as a seat for the tiny dressing counter at the foot of the bed, fit perfectly under the sink and was out of the way, making it more manageable getting around the bed for that middle of night trip to the bathroom. It was 2 short blocks from the Trevi Fountain on a lovely little street just of Tritoni and a couple of blocks from Piazza Barberini. We walked nearly everywhere including the Colosseum and St Petes. The employees behind the front desk were lovely, friendly and helpful and the breakfast was superb and included American scrambled eggs as well as the more typical Italian fare. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: suepnz
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We arrived from NZ after 30 hours flying and asked if we could have a quiet room. This was provided and while the room was small the bed was one of the most comfortable we had ever slept in. It was also great being able to raise the top of the bed (electrically) to get a comfortable position to read. The air conditioning was just right too. Breakfast was delicious, lots of lovely fresh fruit, cereals and pastries. The staff were super friendly and helpful and the location was perfect. Just down the lane and you were at Trevi Fountain and it was a very easy walk to all major attractions. Loved our three night here and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, updated, clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: monalisa_1022
Reviews.Content: White Hotel was my very first hotel in Italy and I was a little nervous about what I would find once there. I'm used to finer hotels in the US and learned that standards can be different in Europe. I can't say enough good things about White Hotel. It's in a great location with wonderful trattorias, cafes and shops, not to mention, only 2 short blocks to the Trevi Fountain. The staff was accommodating and friendly. I found the rooms to be modern, clean and tastefully decorated. My room was a double even though I stayed there by my self so I was very comfortable. The shower stalls are small, but that's typicaly in Italy I understand. Rooms are equipped with a mini-bar, i-Pod docking station, flat screen TV and an electric teapot to heat water for instant coffee or tea which are provided in the room. All in all, I was very happy with my stay at White Hotel and would highly recommend it to travellers who are used to a level of comfort and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spot”
Reviews.Author: MartaGaspar
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The from desk man was usually nice and usefull. The bedroom had nice and new furniture, it was not big at all. I had a problem with the two televisions because they were so close to each other that we could not turn one of them on with out having the other one turned on too. The bathroom was very confortable and large. The breakfast was ok, with the regular staff for a european hotel. From the hotel to Trevi Fountain are four steps! And with more ten steps you can get to so many atractions.... I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Rudest consierge ever”
Reviews.Author: Fran D
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days at the Hotel White and I would never bother with it again. The rooms were tiny and poorly laid out. I had no problems with the cleanliness of the the room or bathroom but, boy, was it tiny. We were to board our ship on the last day and tried to get some help from the consierge with regards to getting to the port. To say that he was less then helpful would be an understatement. When we worked out that he couldn't help us other then to offer a trip for 150 euros to the port, we asked him for the name of a cab company, tour company anything to get us to the ship. He informed us that he wouldn't give us the details for "a competitor". We then asked for assistance regarding the train to the port. He proceeded to go into a SONG AND DANCE routine about how difficult it would be for us to get our luggage on and off the train, We found out later that there were only 3 steps to navigate at the station and was no trouble at all. All in all, a very disappointing end to our stay in Rome. I won't hurry back.

Reviews.Title: “Singles - beware!”
Reviews.Author: JaneVictoria
Reviews.Content: The Hotel White is indeed in a fabulous location. I booked in to have a 'treat' at the end of a long holiday in Europe. As a single woman, I expected to always have a 'battle' with the hotels I stayed in - however they were all wonderful with great rooms UNTIL I arrived at the Hotel White. I was shown into the smallest, bleakest room imaginable, a minute window looking over rubbish and the furnishings cheap and uninviting. I refused to stay there and had the 'battle' with the arrogant young man at the desk. After a lot of shrugging, he finally sent me around to another hotel. They ignored my request for some compensation as the other hotel was much cheaper. I spent the next few days perusing other hotels for future reference. Singles, do NOT stay at the Hotel White! Jane Hills (Melbourne)

Reviews.Title: “Close to Trevi Fountain - Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MontiNb
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and clean and the breakfast had a good variety.The location was good close to a number of attractions. The front desk staff were great in the afternoon and night and "Joey" was excellent. He helps with your luggage, fixes any problems, doubled as bar man? and was a lot of fun. Make sure you give him a tip. Our room had a fair bit of street noise at night and early in the morning when they emptied the garbage,as we were at the front of the building. Overall a nice place to stay. The Bar and Grill restaurant next door had good meals and also had vegetables which were sometimes hard to get.

Reviews.Title: “I loved staying at Hotel White”
Reviews.Author: spricey11
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went to Rome for the first time at the end of May. After a lot of research we settled on staying at the Hotel White. We absolutely loved our stay there. All the staff- from Conceirges, to housekeeping, to the bellhop guy, to the people that did breakfat- were helpful and friendly. They were very attentative. The Concierge even noticed when we were gone all day (we took a day trip to Pompeii) and was worried when they hadn't seen us. We liked it so much that we stayed an extra day. The rooms were modern, comfortable and clean. Breakfast was great! And the location was absolutely perfect- literally like a block to Trevi Fountain, and a quick walk to Spanish Steps, Pantheon, and Piazza Navona. Around the hotel there were lots of little places to eat and souvenir shops for those quick last minute gifts. Anyway, we loved our stay there and definitely recommend this to anyone that visits Rome. Hopefully we can come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “next to san crispi gelato and trevi fountains, a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: loonytraveller
Reviews.Content: ok, this hotel is just on the way to the trevi fountains, and near the spanish steps, and very comfortable. the rooms are in modern style and all white, and hence quite pleasant. rooms are well done, in room tea/coffee, paid internet/wifi, good breakfast and centrally located. i realised that one could actually do rome by foot, and in a day, and this hotel would be a good base camp for this. would recommend this hotel. the only grouse is, that incase of a lower floor room overlooking the road, it could get noisy with the tourists passing by...but did the trevi fountains at 6.30 in the morning! and not a soul there, and could take all the photos we needed...(was up early to catch a flight..)

Reviews.Title: “what a letdown”
Reviews.Author: danatellaCardiff
Reviews.Content: good location - the major reason for booking here - but didn't come near its 4-star rating - more a downmarket experience. No facilities to talk of in the hotel. The bar is dead (never open during our stay) but minibar in rooms is reasonably priced. Beds are hard, and the matress has a towel as a cover beneath the too-small sheets. Air-con too hot even when turned off. Very cheap approach to in-room tea and coffee (disposable plastic cups in room, and disposable plastic "glasses" in bathroom) cheap toiletries, very shabby bathroom - paint peeling, marble crusted with limescale, threadbare towels. Safe didn't work. Cleaning of rooms was very hit-and-miss; we think the regular cleaner was OK but when she was off the replacement didn't care much. Breakfast edible. Staff pleasant enough

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sydneykim42
Reviews.Content: Very groovy hotel rooms that were very modern in excellent location. The trevi fountain and spanish steps were just a walk away. the staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was delicious. Next door was a restaurant that offered discounts to hotel guests. This was also delicious. The only thing I would complain about was air conditioning could not be controlled and was FREEZING. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: CindyG1
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing. I wish I could be there for half the year and here half the year. The food alone was so wonderful and the sights exquisit leveryplace you look. The hotel was lovely and I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: GerardMcL
Reviews.Content: Hi, My wife and I stayed here whilst celebrating our wedding anniversary. I read a few of the negative views before I left but the hotel were offering a great deal and I booked. It was the best decision I made. This is a fantastic hotel. The rooms are quite small but they are a similar size throughout mainland Europe. The rooms were however clean, tidy and the decor was modern and stylish. The bathroom was a good size and we couldn't have asked for much more. The staff were courteous and answered any questions we had. The breakfast is your standard European breakfast. The Location of the Hotel is absolutely superb. Your are 1 minute from the Trevi Fountain and 3 minute walk from The Pantheon and the Piazza Navona. Just up the street there is a metro station which leaves you to the Vatican with a 5 minute trip. I enjoyed everything about our stay here and should we return to Rome which I sincerely hope we do I will have no hesitation in booking the Hotel White

Reviews.Title: “bad service”
Reviews.Author: einatcn
Reviews.Content: wonderful location, clean but extremly tiny room. bad service. the staff expects and let the guest understand that : a constant flow of tips or you get a very unpleasant stay.i will return to beautiful rome but not to hotel white.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Wish rooms were bigger!”
Reviews.Author: goblondie
Reviews.Content: Firstly the location was great!! Right near the Trevi Fountain and nice places to eat. We found our found to be pretty quiet considering its location, although the air con machines out side were a little nosy but after inspection we found that there were hundreds on every building. Breakfast was nice, simple but nice. THe staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms however were SO SMALL!!!! we could barely open the door without hitting the bed frame. Its such a shame about that! For the price we paid, I think the rooms should of been bigger. But the location was great. Beds were pretty comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: melaniepenn
Reviews.Content: when arriving at Hotel White, my partner and i were told that they had no reference to our booking and that Fastbooking.com who we had booked through had never sent through our booking. they then said they had no room for us but toorrow night we could have an "executive Suite". The most worrying thing about this whole experience was that the hotel was not even suprised or apologetic!

Reviews.Title: “White Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: gadidan
Reviews.Content: The beginning was promising. The White hotel is centrally located and within a close walking distance to all major attractions in Rome. We arrived at 11:00AM and were given a room despite our early check-in. We were assigned to room #304, which turned out to be a tinny little box. After complaining at the front desk, we were reassigned to the junior suite, which resolved the size problem. The room was OK, yet doesn’t live up to the standard of a four star hotel. The furniture and design is not really “modern” or “contemporary,” and certainly isn’t white (which kind of begs the question – why do they call this place the White Hotel?). The TV channels were barley viewable. The towels have seen better days (probably a decade ago). There is no iron in the entire hotel, which is simply unacceptable. Although the hotel is located in the heart of a romantic city such as Rome attaching two twin beds and calling this a “double” doesn’t really qualify for a romantic getaway. Breakfast was very nice and included everything we needed to get our day started.

Reviews.Title: “Central & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: nick2maz
Reviews.Content: Great value, friendly helpful staff,. Rooms very quiet till very late , no hoovering the carpets at 9am. No traffic noise ( rare in Rome) Breakfast great. Rooms compact but nicely done. Have stayed at the Aldrovandi Palace in Rome this is a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “A solid hotel, nicely located.”
Reviews.Author: tickleberry
Reviews.Content: The hotel was convenient and very safe. Walking to any of the major attractions was not a problem, and even though it was right near the Trevi Fountain which is a circus, the room was very quiet. The room was very small though, but we only used it to sleep and nap in between sites. It's quite close to the Barberini metro station, we never once took a cab in Rome and we saw everything you'd want to see thanks to the location. The front desk was helpful and friendly. The breakfast was average but there were enough selections to get full before a day of touring. The price was "ouch", the major downside. But it was clean and we had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jolize
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable value for money. We could not believe our luck when we checked into this hotel. It was very well located and within comfortable walking distance of all the major attractions, including some stunning restaurants. The rooms were AND bathrooms were spacious (rare for Europe) and seems like very newly renovated in crisp modern white. We had a small hic up when we checked in with room availability but the staff really went totally out of their way to compensate us for any inconvenience. We loved the fact that we were around the corner from the Trevi fountain! This is a hotel we will certainly go back to, next time we will also stay longer than 3 days in Rome - what a magical place!

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Wunderlust55
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the White Hotel in the beginning of August. The location was perfect. We were in the hub of Rome and could easily walk to all the sights. The staff was wonderful, friendly, helpful and kind. Breakfast was perfect, you could fill up on fruit, yogurt, pastries or bacon and eggs and it kept you going for most of the day. the fresh peaches were even better than Okanagan peaches from BC! they were amazing. The local restaurants were good, especially "thats amore" at the end of the street. We really didnt like the restaurant next door to the hotel though. Remember that it costs extra to eat in, that was something we had to get used to! We always felt safe walking at night, Rome is very clean and surprisingly quiet compared to cities like NY where horns blare all day, not so in rome, maybe a few beeps from the scooter and thats tolerable! Would definately stay there again. We had the only room on the 3rd floor with a teeny weeny balcony that was perfect, once you closed the door you didnt here a sound.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: lanny56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel White for 6 nights in July. We had a junior suite room plus an extra room for our daughter all which were located behind another door for privacy. It was like a two bedroom suite. The location is excellent so close to every tourist attraction, the metro, and shopping. The staff were friendly and helpful with any requests. The breakfast was adequate for us and as Italains really don't do brekkie we thought it was pretty well done - hot/ cold etc. We would definitely stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay! Room 201, NO PROBLEMS!”
Reviews.Author: lesley999Walsall
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a short break. Although we had to stay in their sister hotel Accademia for our first night (due to water problems) we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and can recommend both hotels. To compensate for this the management upgraded us to a suite and put a bottle of fizzy wine in our room. As others have stated both hotels are brilliantly located a couple of minutes from Trevi Fountain and in pedestrianised streets. It was an easy walk to many other tourist attractions and only a few mins walk to the nearest metro (Barbini) if you needed it. The staff were helpful and friendly and we had no problems with street noise from our room. Breakfast was good and consisted of everything most people would want! Would certainly stay here again if we visit Rome again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Room 201 was the best room we have stayed in during our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: vandermost
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our Honeymoon, which we spent in Italy. We spent time in florence, Rome and Palermo. By far, and I do mean By far the nicest hotel of our trip was the New and contemporary design Hotel, HOTEL WHITE. We stayed in room 201 and the airconditioning was working perfectly, the room was by far the largest of the hotel, and was huge. I spent a lot of times in all kinds of hotels and this was definately a huge room. The check in was great, we received a bottle of champagne and were pleased and pampered our complete stay. DEFINETELY A HOTEL WHERE WE WOULD RETURN...TO ROOM 201 It is funny to read that some people are not agreeing with me, read below;), but they must have gone to a completely different Hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: NYorks_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 night at the Hotel White and found it a reasonable place to stay. The location is excellent, it really is only a 100 yards to the Trevi fountain, it's also a good location for the Metro and a short walk to the Spanish Steps, Pantheon and Piazza Navona. The rooms was small but on a par for a European city hotel, the hotel was clean and the staff pleasant. The breakfast buffet was fine, a selection of pastries and rolls, cereals, yoghurts, meat and cheese and some hot bacon, sausage and eggs. Overall this is a good base to stay in Rome,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: S_YorksYorkies
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel for my 50th birthday so did pay more than we normally would. We booked a twin room, which was ready for us on arrival and we were very pleasantly surprised. The room was spacious and despite only being 2 of us we had twin beds, TV & bathroom (toilet & washbasin) downstairs but stairs led us to a double bed, TV and bathroom (bidet, toilet washbasin & shower). All were pristine. Air conditioning was working, there was no noise from the street and the breakfast was very good. The reception were very friendly and helpful. The only criticisms are there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room and one evening we would have liked a drink in the courtyard area but they did not serve hot drinks from the lounge bar and the fridge was not working for a cold beer - only shorts available. However, these were only minor issues for us. The location is excellent - we walked everywhere from the hotel with the exception of the Vatican which we were told by reception would take us an hour. Still not sure about that one - maybe Italians only stroll? :) The Trevi fountain is only a minute away and we were able to go there before breakfast and have our photo taken whilst there was no one else there - an impossibility during the day. We would definitely recommend it to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “rm 201 was the worth room I have ever paid for.”
Reviews.Author: sleepdeprived08
Reviews.Content: When we arrived it was evident that the air conditioning was not working, we had rented a large room with 2 twin beds and 1 full bed. We were offered a small 2 twin bed room for the same price we were paying for the large room, Everyday the management promised the air conditioning would be fixed. It was never fixed. The hotel didn't offer to reduce out room rate. We suffered from sleep deprivation, I was warned to be careful at the ATM machines and about the pick pockets, but not about the hotels that rip you off. It was truly the worst hotel experience of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Indifference Led to Shortened Vacation-Beware of Rm. #201”
Reviews.Author: dfwpetlover
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th and last stay at Hotel White. Arrived on May 7th to no air conditioning in a room so stiffling hot we could barely breathe, mentioned to front desk and was told since it was Friday our air would be turned on by Monday. They also offered us a different room 1/3 size and same price. We declined. Computer downstairs lobby didn't work 2 of 5 days we were there so looking for different hotel was difficult. We were assigned room #201 which is located on the front side about 15 feet off the street and just above a restaurant with live music until midnight. at 1 am street cleaner makes 3 passes, 3 a.m. garbage pick up, 6 a.m. food delivery. Each and every night. Monday came and went - no air.Tues. no air. Other guests in hotel had air in their rooms. We were to check out on Friday, however, by Wednesday, we were more than ready to leave. Sleep deprived from the noise, we paid $250/ticket to come home 2 days early. Enough was Enough.Wrote letter requesting refund - no response - Just like the problem with air conditioning in room. Seems this hotel is very good about non responding. BEWARE OF ROOM #201 & #101....NIGHTMARE.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Michael1111
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending 1 week in Rome staying at the Hotel White. This hotel is located right in the centre of the city (close to the Trevi fountain) and is perfectly located for visiting all the main sights. The small street outside is free from traffic, but does get quite busy during the day and early evening with pedestrians walking past, however there is no problem with noise. It is a very clean hotel, where the personnel are friendly and helpful. Despite it looking typically old from the outside, the rooms are very modern and extremely ‘white’. We were told by the receptionist that all the rooms on the second floor had recently been refurbished and were only finished 2 months ago. We would definitely return to this hotel the next time we visit Rome and would recommend it to anyone wishing to explore the sights of this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrazyForVacations
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Italy and we loved Hotel White. We stayed 3 nights and would recommend it to anyone. It was our most expensive hotel in Italy but for Rome it was reasonable (160 Euros per night I think). Like everyone has mentioned the location can't be beat, very close to the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Barbarini metro stop, etc. Compared the many of the hotel breakfasts we've had throughout Europe we thought it was plentiful...a wide variety of pastries, fruit, cheese/meats, yogurt, cereal, etc. All the restuarants we ate dinner at were very close by, great food and reasonably priced. We also grabbed sandwiches from a few of the markets in the area for lunch during the day. Internet access is available for 3 Euros for one hour. The hotel staff speaks English and was helpful. The rooms are small but pretty normal by Europe standards. The room was clean and updated so I can't think of anythign to complain about! I'd recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “will return”
Reviews.Author: DublinDeborah
Reviews.Content: just returned from a great weekend break at white hotel,yes i do agree with other reviews the rooms are small,we had standard room but everything you could want for weeknd break as you dont really spend that much time in the room too much to see.the location was great on the same street as the trevi fountain,lots of nice places to eat.the The tea and coffee facilites and ipod dock was nice bonus in the room,will return to this hotel next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Gem812
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here, the staff upon check in were great, they realised that we had had a long journey and helped us up with our luggage. Our room was abit cramped for three of us, but was lovely. We had one double bed and a pull out bed in our room, but we had to keep folding the pull out bed up to get around the room. The room was ideal for a base though as we weren't in the room very often. The location of this hotel is perfect, we walked to all the main attractions, the Trevi fountain is just down the road and the Colosseum was about a 15 minute walk. We found some excellant ice cream palours and a pizza place that you could buy slices of pizza. If I was visiting Rome again I would definately stay here due to the excellant location.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern rooms, nice bathroom -if going back to Rome to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maskil
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a 4 star hotel and has been remodeled to reflect the 21st century, which is not a given taking into consideration that most of the hotels in Rome are on the "old" side. We had asked for a double and received a bonus, a bedroom and a separate living room, all done in the colors of "white" and natural wood. The floors were parquet and as we had requested a bathtub, we indeed received one. The staff is very hospitable, breakfast is decent, and the location is prime. Right in the middle of all the restaurant and shopping district, in a quiet alley. Everything is walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: flavell7
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel does not appear to be much - as it is situated within what first seems to be an alley. After inspection this alley is actually and beautiful cobbled street that leads onto Trevi fountain, filled with restaurants and shops etc. A truly remarkable location in a beautiful city. The hotel itself is a fine city hotel - typically italian in the sense of theres not much to it. When we went they were refurbishing the hotel - so there was a little noise in the day - on the plus side we got a new room which was excellent and came with a jacuzzi bath!!!! I loved this hotel and Rome is beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: livingthedreem
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel White. We booked direct with the hotel through it's web site, and were given an executive room. I must admit it was not a huge room and not what I would call executive, the bathroom is small with an extremely narrow shower! Thought I would check the view from the windows, big mistake! Out of one window was cooking smells and a wall, the other a wall! After saying that the room was perfectly clean, with everything you need for a short stay. The staff were more than helpful and polite, nothing was too much trouble! Breakfast set you up for the day, with an excellent variety on offer. Our package also included being picked up at the airport and a bottle of wine in our room, which was a nice touch after a very early start! The hotel is in a fantastic position to visit all the main attractions, with the Trevi Fountain nearly on your doorstep. You feel safe walking around even at night. Eating out can be expensive, so make sure you don't get charged for the tablecloth! We found a lovely place thats not too expensive and serves good food called "al Picchio" not far from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Claustrophobic rooms”
Reviews.Author: FromSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the fine reviews and the location. We agree the location is good, but just that. All the rest was very disappointing. We had an executive room, very modern looking, but extremely small. Claustrophobic! We had to keep our suitcase under the bathroom sink, and in order to be able to use 2 drawers we had to keep the blankets on the night table; the bed cover had to be put there too. They had an I-pod dock, a coffee machine, a tray with wine and glasses on a 15x60 inch desk/dressing table; therefore we had no space to put neither laptop nor basic make-up stuff. – By the way, this piece of furniture was never dusted. The bathroom looked great at first, but the towels were thin and worn out , clogged shower drain and no possibility to controle water temperature . At first, the shower water was cold, after having complained for 2 days, they inverted the situation and it became boiling hot. We felt as if they were trying to "punish" us for complaining. The staff was very cold, not rude, but barely doing their duty. - Never a smile on their face. The worst thing of all was, the impossible to open, filthy dirty window. It was tiny and close to the ceiling, so you had the feeling you were in a prison cell. Needless to say, we stayed fewer days than our reservation plans.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but ...”
Reviews.Author: Gerties
Reviews.Content: This was not our first choice but the others were booked out. We booked 3 months in advance, for a 6 night stay. Even so it is in a great location, staff supportive, good breakfast with attentive staff, internet in the foyer for 5 Euro for stay. Will do breakfast bags on request if joining early tour - but you need to ask for this. On the down side ... we turned up latish at about 8 pm tired and exhausted only to be told we had no room at the hotel for that night and were taken down the road to a 3 star partner hotel - Hotel Trione. There was no prior communication or explanation. Hotel Trione was an adequate 3 star but aircon was not working, room tiny, beds hard, breakfast adequate. This was not what we had paid for. Free bottle of wine and fruit to compensate. Next 5 nights fine until aircon broke down for final night. We are not sure how often this problem of overbooking or rooms not being available occurs.

Reviews.Title: “Had a lovely time.”
Reviews.Author: purky
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from two nights at the White Hotel in Rome. The hotel is in a fantastic location - just a few minutes walk to the Trevi Fountain and the rest of the sights were all walkable. The executive room on the first floor was clean and well equipped with a flat screen tv on the wall, jacuzzi in the bath and Ipod dock so we could have some music whilst we were getting ready to go out! The breakfast buffet was good - it kept us going for most of the day. To be honest, we didn't spend much time in the hotel as we were out enjoying Rome most of the weekend but I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: essexgirlSurrey
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Monday the 21st July and stayed 4nights returning home yesterday! Fantastic location - perfectly situated 100yds from the Trevi fountain. Room was large with a seperate sitting room, adjustamatic beds and a large bathroom with a Jucuzzi bath!!! There were 2 plasma screen TVs - one in the bedroom and one in the sitting room along with a docking station for your ipod/ mp3 player! Breakfast was adequate and included and the adjoining restaurant was welcoming! Only gripe was that the bar was never open but with everything right on your doorstep it didn't bother us too much. We walked all over Rome - Vatican was within walking distance but public transport is dead cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Great location of the White Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kasionut
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been updated so it boasts some funky art pieces on white walls and lots of mirrors. Great location - 2 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain. However for the price you pay, you would expect bigger rooms and a bathroom you can move freely in. The room me and my boyfriend stayed in, was cosy and quiet but then again it was facing a grubby looking building. So much for the view! The hotel concierge was not very helpful when asked about the local restaurants and insisted that we go to the restaurant next door the hotel has a deal with. Determined to find something less "touristy", we found a real gem - probably the best Italian tratoria in that part of Rome. Tritone is situated in Via Dei Maroniti, 1-3-5. It offers an excellent traditional roman cuisine and a great atmosphere. No wonder the place is always packed, but if you hang around for a while, they will find you a table. Very efficient service! The walls adorned with famous faces - Lucy Liu, Paul Hogan aka Crocodile Dundee, to mention just a few. Added bonus - apparently the best ice cream in Rome called Gelateria San Crispino (!) just round the corner walking anti-clockwise from the tratoria. Flavours galore!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFourNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Stayed in two side by side "garden rooms" with 2 adult daughters. Rooms were spotless with fabulous flat screen tvs. Breakfast was plentiful from fruit to hot items so much so that we never needed to eat lunch! Location can't be beat. Central to everything, we walked to Trevi ( 2 min), Piazza Spagna ( 5 min), Pantheon, etc. Street itself fun with plenty of places to eat and feels safe and friendly. Staff friendly and knowledgeable. very helpful with all questions and requests. We have already rebooked for summer of 08. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: funnycarsummer
Reviews.Content: White Hotel in Rome had a great location. It only cost us 11 Euro to get a taxi there from the main train station. From the hotel we walked everywhere without having to take an organised tour. We visited the Colosseum, Vatican City, the Pantheon and was only about 100 metres from the Trevi Fountain. We had great joy most evenings just going to the fountain and people watching. The rooms were small with the bathroom being especially small, we had trouble with the drain in the shower blocking after the water had been on for only about 30 seconds. We complained after our second night the day before we checked out and it was fixed that day. We should have done that to start with. The lift was out of order for the first 24 hours and we were on the third floor so that added to our exercise. The room was very clean, the staff especially helpful and the breakfast was excellent. This was one of the few places in Europe that served eggs for breakfast. Once again the hotel's location was its' best point.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Explore88
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel which is in the middle of everything. The rooms are modern, very clean and well facilitated. The hotel staff are attentive and meet all your requests with a pleasant smile and a fast turnaround. There is an extensive range of food for breakfast and I would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again. There are many local restaurants in walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pitsstoptravelclub
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location to see all the sights in Rome,the Trevi Fountain is literally a 2min stroll from hotel,the colosseum 20 mins,Pantheon 15 mins.Although the hotel is on the street to the Trevi with lots of restauraunts and shops as it is mostly pedestrianised it is quiet. The staff are very friendly and breakfast is excellent lots of fresh bread,parma ham, scrambled eggs and fab coffee. We stayed in a standard room which was tiny (three strides across)very clean with nice marble bathroom,mini bar,T.V. ect. I would definately stay there again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it. The only problem we had with the hotel was noise from rennovation work being done on 1st floor which started at 8am.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Bospass
Reviews.Content: My original booking was with Hotel Tritone which is run by the same company as Hotel White (and Hotel Accademia, www.travelroma.com). However due to some problems with the rooms I was offered a room at Hotel White for the same rate. As a reference, Hotel Tritone was listed as 3-stars while Hotel White was 4-stars. The hotel is excellently located just far enough from Trevi Fountain to avoid the masses yet centrally located enough to be a short walk to the Barbarini subway stop, the Spanish Steps and even to the Colosseum. I was put into a standard room which was equipped with cable TV (10 channels or so), in-room programmable safe, mini-bar, pants press and some other nice touches including toiletries and slippers. The doors are keycard controlled, no keys to drop off at the reception desk. You do need to put your key into the slot to activate the electricity in the room but the bellhop will walk you through all of that including programming the safe. The hotel offers free breakfast from 7am-10:30am for all guests, 7 days a week. No room tickets are needed and there's a selection to satisfy nearly every type of appetite. It's all you can eat and you can take as many trips as you like. For a nice quiet breakfast show up around 8am before it gets too busy. If you eat between 7-8am you'll probably have the area to yourself which is a nice quiet way to start the morning. There is a computer available for use at the front desk for 5 Euros for the length of your stay. Wifi is free in the reception and lounge area but does not extend to the rooms. No filters of any type were apparent on the internet access. The area around the hotel is very safe and I had no problems returning to the hotel between 2-5am on multiple nights during my stay. The main issue you will have is trying to get back in the front door as the doorman is usually not at the front desk during those hours. But if you knock on the door he'll appear within a minute or so usually. The hotel is located right next to Quirinale so there are police around 24/7. There's a grocery store at the corner to the right and plenty of edible pizza orderable by the slice to the left on the way to Trevi Fountain. There were renovations ongoing during my stay but I was already up by the time they started so it didn't bother me. It appears they're renovating the entire 2nd floor which looks promising. Otherwise there's very little crowd or traffic noise and it is very quiet a night so you should have no problems even if you're a light sleeper. The hotel took credit cards for payment and offered payment either in US dollars or Euros. They will call taxis for you although I would suggest arranging for your own ride back to the airport if you choose to go by taxi as it seems they do add a surcharge for making the call for you. However getting a taxi to Termini will only cost you whatever the meter reads (about 10 Euros with the night surcharge).

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: natashaTelAviv
Reviews.Content: We paid for standart room but were given new beautiful executive rooms! The staff were helpful and nice. The restaurant next to the hotel -very luxary and good. The locaiton was great -just in the center. We didn't have to use public transportaiton. we will surely get back there! ciao S&S from Israel

Reviews.Title: “The right choice”
Reviews.Author: AlreadyMissingRome
Reviews.Content: When you plan a walking trip thru Rome, a central location for your hotel in highly important. White hotel is located neer the Trevi, and no more then half an hour walk to ALL major rome tourist sites. This lets you site-seeing all day, rest your feet and regroup in your room, and enjoy a relaxed evening tour well rested. Hotel personal are great and helpful. Breakfast will more then meet your needs with a very nice and varied buffet. Sure, this hotel costs (a lot of) money, but worths your weight in gold. You will NOT be disappointed - worth every penny. "Chau"

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: ezh70
Reviews.Content: Hotel White is well located about 2 minutes walk from the Trevi Fountain and close to all other major sites. We were able to walk everywhere - Colluseum, Vatican, Spanish Steps etc. Breakfast was very good and efficient, hot and cold food available. The room we had was very small!! Just enough space to get round the bed, and the bathroom was also very small - I could bearly sit down in the bath!! Staff were helpful, the hotel was very clean and the room was cleaned thoroughly every day. If you are looking for super luxury - this is not the place for you, if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in an excellent location then book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonJennie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last October for a long weekend, and had a great time. The staff were very helpful, offering us useful info and recomendations for tours and sightseeing. Nice hearty breakfasts in the morning, and the restuarant that is attached to the hotel do gorgeous traditional Italian food, with a lounge singer to entertain. Nice size rooms and marble bathrooms, and a mini bar stocked with all the essentials at a very reasonable price. The hotel is located about 5 mins walk from the beautiful Trevi fountain, along a street lined with shops, restauarnts and bars. Bus/underground links are also just a five minute walk away. The only downside about the Hotel White is that there is little natural light, as most of the windows have heavy shutters on them that dont seem to open, and the breakfast room is below street level. Combined with the dark decor, the hotel is quite moody and dark. This could be similar to all hotels in Rome though, and is just personal moan! Rome is an incredible city and I loved my weekend here. The Hotel White was a perfect base to explore the city, would reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: farajpur
Reviews.Content: A very good location, and nice rooms - all the facilities are new and clean, the service was very good, and breakfast was rich and tasty. We recommend others to stay in this hotel Danny & Tami Porat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: o5brock
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel White for our first two nights in Rome and then again for our last night . We loved the close proximity to all the major attractions and Via Del Costa the main street that runs from top to bottom of Rome, very easy to get around. Only about 100 meters to the Trevi Fountain, and close to banks, restaurants and plenty of shopping. The staff were very friendly and the internet facility great for catching up with people back home. The breakfast that we had here were the best that we had in all our stay in Italy, great selection and great service. Rooms very comfortable and nicely furnished. We will head straight back to Hotel White when in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Bit Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: BertieWiltshire
Reviews.Content: Part of the hotel has been renovated and part has not. Make sure you find out what your paying for as the older rooms are tired and you will find things broken.The hotel calls itself a 4*. Most of the reviews call it 2* or 3*. The reviews are right. There are plenty modest quality hotels in the centre of Rome and you must be happy with the price you are paying. I paid 200 euros less than a 5* over a four day break and when I visited some 5* hotels felt that the White hotel was expensive and poor value for money. Good location. Some staff helpful others not. Choose carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at White Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLVCardiff
Reviews.Content: We booked for a quad room via British Airways but were given an appartment opposite the hotel - this was spacious, clean and very roomy, also gave us the option to self cater. Location great [if a bit noisy from people walking past in the evening] and staff helpful. Olympia Trattoria 2 minutes walk away across the main road did great food at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “White was right”
Reviews.Author: EFTF
Reviews.Content: We stayed comfortably at the White Hotel for our four-day, first time visit to Rome. As others point out, the central location is ideal for walking to Rome's main attractions and the Barberini subway station. The free buffet and coffee with steamed milk helped us start each day right. Also, the evening concierge made WONDERFUL dinner recommendations. Cautions - while we weren't expecting a large bathroom, it would be an understatement to call our shower small. You could barely turn around without knocking into the temperature knob. It also leaked terribly. Finally, DO NOT be swayed by the 10% discount for the Food and Wine restuarant in the hotel -- we're not sure if the food or lounge singer was worse. Go out and explore!

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute Booking Great Hotel White”
Reviews.Author: GrahamNoel
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel White eight days before we went. Neither my husband or I had been to Rome before so decided to find a hotel that was central to everywhere. On arrival at the airport a very handsome italian gentleman was waiting for us {I had booked a car to be waiting for us] and he ushered us to his black , top of the range mercades (talk about arrive in style}. From the minute that we walked into the hotel we knew that we had made a good choice. Our room was right above the entrance to the hotel so we could see or the comings and goings of the very busy narrow road, but once you closed the shutters in the evening you could not hear hardly anything outside, so a good nights sleep was had. Breakfast was self service but plenty of it - cold meats, cerial, toast breads, yogorts fruit etc. The only thing that we found to pass comment on was that you could not get a drink in the hotel bar as there was never anyone in there to serve you. It would have been nice to have sat there and had a drink before going out for a meal in the evening. We had some lovely meals out during our stay, the best one being at Il Chianti - great food and atmosphere (turn left out of the hotel} two minutes walk away. Infact during our four night stay we went here twice. All in all, great location and we would deffinitely return on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Simonthevanman
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, just a minutes walk from the Trevi Fountain. Rooms are great, just what I would expect from a central city hotel, although the shower head could do with cleaning out. We emailed ahead to ensure we got a double at the top of the hotel and thats exactly what we had, albeit round the back so, not a great view but nice and quiet. The attached restaurant, Grill and Wine was simply great, really friendly service especially from the older guy on the door, who thanked us at the end for our custom and made us feel really welcome. And the food, well it was exactly what we went to Rome for!!! I can especially recommend the clams.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teealow
Reviews.Content: A pretty nice hotel and centrally located but there is absolutely no view at all. There is beautiful wood trim and marble throughout the hotel and rooms. The size of the room we stayed in was adequate and it was very clean. One weird thing was that our air conditioning was controlled by the front desk. You had to call them in order to get the temperature changed. The desk clerk was not the friendliest person either but neither were the Italian people in general.

Reviews.Title: “Small dinky old room”
