Reviews.Author: RetiredTom
Reviews.Content: At 300 Euros per night we were expecting a nice spacious room with at least a full size bed instead we got a tiny room with two twin beds jammed together (and made up seperately!). Not very romantic indeed. Staff refused to modify rate when we complained. Great location near Trevi Fountain. They did have a good complimentary buffet breakfast. Great Coffee! Lots of good restaurants and cafe's nearby! Definitly not a 4 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AreThereAnyNamesLeft
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I spent four nights at the Hotel White at the beginning of August. It is in a perfect location (308 paces from the Trevi Fountain) and within easy walking distance of all the sights (Forum, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Vatican etc etc) and the shops. It's so close you can get up at 6am to go and see the Trevi Fountain with no one else there and be back in bed at 6:25. The room was clean and comfortable (and in good nick) and while not massive was perfect for our needs; although the bathroom was a little on the small side it was perfectly adequate. There is an electronic safe in the room (you set the code) and a minibar which is very useful as a fridge. If you are as tight as I am you can go to the local Spar shop to replace items from the minibar before the maid comes round - it works out at about a quarter of the price (3 euros for one can of Heineken from the minbar or 1.65 for two cans from Spar). Breakfast was excellent - the dining room was very clean, and there was no problem with food runnning out. We turned up a couple of times at 10am (breakfast finishes at 10:30) and there was plenty of food left. There were sticky croissants, pastries, cereal, toast, fruit, cold cheese and meat, scrambled egg, bacon and mini frankfurters (when in Rome!), fruit juice and of course coffee and tea. All the hotel staff were very friendly and spoke adequate English. We were on the top floor at the back of the hotel and never had a problem with noise; and the aircon was very efficient. The map the hotel gives you on arrival was excellent we never left 'home' without it. A top tip if you are planning to visit the Colosseum: don't wait in the queues outside but pop down to the Palatine Hill ticket office, a short walk away, and buy a combined ticket to the Palatine and Colosseum for 11 euros. You can then return to the Colosseum, march past all the queues and go straight to the turnstile at the front. And then go and visit the Palatine later. On a general note we felt Rome to be safe if you exercise common sense. Just be aware of the red rose guys down at Trevi and their little scam of 'giving' you roses and then asking for 'a little something'. Just be firm and say no. They get the message eventually; more tedious than threatening and at least they are polite. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bait/switch?”
Reviews.Author: rwny
Reviews.Content: Booked the White Hotel in Rome several months in advance of our planned 2 night stay in May 2006. Upon our arrival at the hotel we were informed by the desk clerk that the hotel was full and we would be moved to their sister hotel, the Accademia. The Accademia is several blocks away, but in the same Trevi Fountain neighborhood. The Accademia stay was actually pleasant - but this same last minute switch was repeated with several other couples over our 3 day stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, rooms very spacious with separate living room and bedroom. Don't leave windows open at night the noise is crazy, very quiet when windows are closed. Shower didn't work, but I found that with every hotel we had, that is if they had one. Most have hand held shower and that's all.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother, my son and I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel White for 4 nights, 2006 March 6-10. The location was great, Its 2 minutes walk from the Trevi Fountain (100 yards), in a good area with all types of restaurants and shops. You are able to walk to all the sights from here, near The Pantheon, The Spanish steps, The Foro. The staff at the reception were very efficient and helpful. The Room was quite large and very clean, including minibar and TV, air conditioned, which you could control, and was quiet. Our stay was perfect. Rome is a wonderful city whith people friendly. The buffet breakfast was varied and fresh and plenty to eat (hot and cold food, fruit, pastries, bacon, eggs, etc.) The bathroom was clean and modern and pleasant. When we go back to Rome, this is definitely where we will be staying.I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, some complaints..”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Tourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel White in March 06, chosen based on previous tripadvisor reviews. Firstly, accomodation in Rome is expensive so bearing that in mind, the Hotel White is good value for money (around €180 a night in March). Good points... excellent location, a minute from the Trevi fountain, and walking distance of all other sights. We walked everywhere, no need for taxis or buses etc. Spotlessly clean room, great breakfast, sound-proofed rooms, english speaking staff. Our room was probably one of the nicer ones, up on 3rd floor and with a bath, but the bathroom was so tiny you couldnt really use the bath! The whole room was small but I guess its to be expected in a cramped city. Bad points.. Just read previous poster re: A/C. Am annoyed now!! We had exactly the same problem, the room was very very stuffy with window closed, and very noisy with window open. I asked 3 times (3 different staff memebers) for A/C to be turned on / room made cooler and each time I was told this would be done, no problems. Of course this never happened as now I read that the A/C is not turned on at all in March!! I wish the staff had told me this instead of making me think our A/C was broken and that they were ignoring my requests. The staff were polite enough but you get the feeling they are laughing at you when you walk away, in fact we saw them do this when some guests were complaining at the front desk. This is very unprofessional and I did not like that attitude, but they were helpful with booking us restaurants and airport transfers etc. They are just not good with complaints! So, yes I would recommend this hotel based on excellent location, cleanliness, breakfast, value for money, sound-proofed rooms, but the staff could be better and the A/C needs to be switched on in March! Ps. The restaurant next door is really excellent (The Grill and Wine). The staff here are lovely and very charming, would really recommend it for food, service and atmosphere. You can get as many 15% discount cards as you wish, just ask the hotel reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff at White”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 great nights in Rome. The weather was superb for March, bright & sunny with temps of 15 - 18C. We were going to take the train & metro from the airport but instead took the mini bus for only 15 Euros each & he dropped us right outside the hotel, although we had to stop at couple of other hotels first to drop people off. Transport organised by hotel to return us to airport cost us 40E. although that was only for us. Location of White's is great, very central for all the sights, & close to shopping areas. One of the best things was that every member of staff spoke English so no misunderstandings. In fact almost everywhere we went people spoke in English as soon as they realised our Italian was limited to Bonjourno. We walked everywhere & found some great Piazza's close by for good food & drink If you want to experience Rome don't be tempted to stay in the "chain hotels" as they are all so far from the centre you will miss out. The hotel is comfortable and very clean, but beware standard rooms are very small with only a shower, no bath. However, I suspect many of the cental Rome hotels are like this as space is such a premium. Also make sure you request a room at the back of hotel as those on the front are very noisy. Once the people have left the street cafes etc, the cleaning trucks come round at 3 & 4am. One annoying point was that I had specifically booked a hotel with Air conditioning so we could keep the windows closed at night as we knew Rome was a noisy city. However, we discovered that the a/c is centrally controlled and was not operational in March as it was still classed as winter. So we had to have the windows open as the room was far too stuffy without and had disturbed nights. However, if we had asked I am sure they would have moved us. The breakfast room is more than adequate, continental style breakfast was plentiful and of decent quality. As highlighted by previous reviewer, we never saw the bar open. The food at the restaurant next door where guests get 15% discount is great and they have live music every night. Also the best ice cream shop in Rome, San Crispios where they handmake the most delicious flavours in small batches, is just around the corner from the hotel. Don't miss it. By the way Rome is very expensive, especially if you want to sit down to relax to eat and drink & watch the world go by so take plenty of money with you as those cappucino's & ice creams soon eat into your funds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: baxi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with my wife in late Feb 2006. As stated in other reviews, the location is superb. We walked everywhere including the Vatican (35 mins) and Colosseum (20 mins). Pantheon is only just over 5 mins walk with Trevi a few hundred yards walk on the same street as the Hotel. The Hotel is very clean, staff friendly and breakfast had plenty choices. We did however encounter a few problems, the day we arrived they were overbooked and we had to stay in a single room (with an extra bed squeezed in) which left no room to even walk around. however to make up for this we were given a suite for the remaining 3 days so no complaints. The bar in the Hotel seems to be rarely manned, we never saw a barman! One night we arrived in the hotel around 10.30pm went to the bar to be told the barman had left early to catch a bus, so if you are looking for late night drinking this is not the place for you. In terms of the voucher for 15% off at the adjoining restaurant you can have as many of these as you want (not just one) For any British visitors you may want to know that the Albert Pub is just across the main road less than a minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel, better location.”
Reviews.Author: Fuzzboy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay in the Hotel White with my wife and 15 month old son. We booked a standard double room and on arrival were put in room 112 which had a seperate bedroom and seating area,ideal with the little one, for whom they provided a cot with crisp fresh linen that was treated like a bed by the room service. Hotel is obviousley not used to such young guests on a regular basis but they went out of their way to be helpfull and make life as easy as possible. The staff, from the chamber maid to the front desk were all very professional and helpfull, most staff appeared to have a much better grasp of English than I do of Italian and when asked for information or assistance seemed eager to help. As for the hotel itself, it is located a 60 second stroll from the Trevi Fountain which I suspect is as good a central location in Rome as you could wish to stay. The room we had did not have much of a view looking out onto the side wall of the building across the alley but it was comfortable, well maintained and there waas very little outside noise. In short I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone, even those travelling with young children. Not the cheapest hotel but certainly not the dearest and I personally felt it was good value for money for both its location and service By the way the breakfast is more than adequate and there should be something for everyonr, from doughnuts to scrambled egg and bacon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from 3 nights at the White Hotel in Rome. As it was my husband's birthday I had previously e-mailed the hotel requesting the best possible room, when we arrived we were taken over to one of the hotel apartments which was really nice, and very clean and spacious. The hotel had even provided us with a bottle of bubbly which I thought was a lovely touch. I also took advice from previous reviews and pre ordered the hotels own Airport car service which was €40 Euros and well worth it as the return taxi to the airport cost 40 Euros and would have cost more if the driver hit heavy traffic!! The food in the restaurant attached to the Hotel was lovely, however my personal favourate had to be eating out at a restaurant in Piaza Navona for the standard of food and the great atmosphere. The prices weren't bad either. The hotel itself has a great location, literally in the same road as the Trevi Fontain which is absolutely beautiful and breathtaking in the evenings. We went to the Colussium which was amazing however I must warn people about the Gladiators outside of the building who will try and rip you off. They approached us when we got out of our taxi, asking us about our trip and before we knew it they'd used our camera to take 3 pictures of us with them and CHARGED US €10 EUROS EACH for the privilage!!!! Do not stop for these people, they may seem freindly but they just want your money.....and lots of it! Overall an excellent weekend, in possibly the most beautiful city I have visited. The hotel was lovely and the staff very friendly and helpful. We loved it that much that we will be returning to Rome for New Year!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location shame about the weather”
Reviews.Author: CBW01
Reviews.Content: Took my partner to Rome for a four day break for his 40th birthday as a surprise, after reading about the hotel, location, city etc knew it would be fantastic. Everything was as expected except for the weather it rained solidly for two whole days but it added to the fun and nothing was spolit as we kept popping into the cafes, shops and touristy places to dry off. The Hotel was situated with everything within 30 minutes walking distance except the Vatican but only a few stops away on the metro.Buy a 3 day pass which allows you to hop on and off the buses and metro. The staff in the restaurants cafe bars etc were brilliant nothing too much trouble. The White hotel was extremely clean, comfortable and the staff very friendly and always available to help with maps, taxis or information, with it being so central you stumble on the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and other breath taking sights without looking for them. When the weather cheered up on the Sunday and Monday, you spent a lot of time in queues, so try to visit places in the afternoon when the big groups of tourists have left. Would go back to both the Hotel and the City again an would recommend it to friends as a must.

Reviews.Title: “Good for small people and those who can live in cupboards!”
Reviews.Author: Farnese
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotel, totally spoilt by the truly awful bedroom. The first room we were shown to was unbelievably small, probably only 7ft by 7ft! I just couldn't accept it and luckily as we checked in mid morning, they were able to offer us another room with the same size bedroom but with a little sitting room attached, so at least we were able to spread out a bit. The room we ended up in had 2 small single beds pushed together and seperately made up. There appeared to be a towel between the matress and the base which I didn't investigate but made the whole room look sordid. Bathroom was OK, minibar and safe were good to have. It was also very dark and the light switches had a mind of their own. What a shame as the staff are fantastic, nothing is too much trouble and they are all knowledgeable and speak excellent English. Location is superb, we walked everywhere. Only stay here if you can cope in very small spaces and don't intend to spend much time in your room!

Reviews.Title: “3 Star not 4 Star?”
Reviews.Author: JanineDav
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights from the 26/9/05 Wanted a hotel with a great location, clean and comfortable. Hotel White delivered all that. Downsides of our five day sunny stay, breakfast's became boring, no fresh fruit or fresh yogurt, toasting machine took ten minutes each slice. The room was reaching a redecoration stage, but not close enough to spoil our stay. The Air Con is very noisy if used above the low setting, I'm glad we didn't stay in the summer months. Our room was not your most expensive, so can only report on our second floor room with views to the close building on the opposite side of the street. I expected more from a 4 star hotel, perhaps in the centre of Rome I expected too much. Most attractions, bars and shops were within easy reach. My top tip, hire the Hotel's taxi from and to the airport, at a charge of 40 euros one way,you save a lot of hassle for the sake of about 10 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jackthegreyhound
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon this place because we had booked a hotel in Rome and then found tripadvisor, and read the place we had booked was awful! The White Hotel got good reviews, so we stayed here in June 2005 for 5 nights. The room, although compact, had everything we needed, including minibar and TV. Shower/Bathroom was marble finished, modern and pleasant. Room was air conditioned, which you could control, and was quiet. Our stay was perfect, in that the staff were efficient, and helpful, breakfasts (Buffet style - included bacon, eggs etc) were huge, and the location was superb - on a little alley leading to Trevi Fountain, with local restaurants (including an excellent one next door associated with the hotel) on your doorstep. We saw just about everything we wanted to see - colleseum, pantheon, vatican, roman forum, shops - without needing to use public transport - everything is walkable (vatican - 20 minutes max - Pantheon was about 5 minutes away). Would recommend this place without hesitation and will be back. One word of warning about Rome - Taxi drivers will quote a price in advance for a trip from the airport, but if your flight is late, or at night, they will try and charge a premium - try and arrange through hotel, and let them argue for you....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We picked the White Hotel based on the reviews we read on this site and the reviews were right on the money! The hotel staff was very helpful in every request and they spoke excellent English. Whether you wanted another city map or a recommendation on a tour, the staff was there to help. The only negative was the air conditioning which was not up to U.S. standards, but opening a window helped cool the room down. Our room was a loft set-up with the bed upstairs and everything else on the lower level. The location was two blocks from the Trevi fountain and walking distance to just about everything else, including the Barberni Metro stop. When we go back to Rome, this is definitely where we will be staying. We took the $40 Euro Vatican Tour and it was well worth the investment!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Timberlnd3
Reviews.Content: Hotel White has just about the best location that you can get in Rome. Blocks from Trevi Fountain, The Pantheon, The Spanish steps, not far from the ruins. The service was spectacular, all staff was courteous and helpful, well above average for italian hotels. The area is loaded with all types of restaurants and shops. The rooms got a little stuffy, but were fine with the windows open. The bathroom was small but one of the nicest I have seen in Italy. The rooms are newer looking and small but comfortable. Would recommend to anyone.
